Dunlap, CA 93621

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live animals.
citations.narrative:
In October of 2023, the facility transported an approximately 6 week old mountain lion cross-country in a vehicle, the
animal was outside of a primary enclosure for portions of the trip. In video documentation, facility staff can be seen
holding the animal in their laps and placing the animal on the floor of the moving vehicle with no other form of restraint or
control. Although, the animal was noted to be in good condition, healthy, and receiving proper care during inspection,
transporting animals without the use of a primary enclosure puts them at risk of injury in the event of an accident. When in
transit, it is necessary to ensure regulated animals are housed in enclosures meeting transportation regulatory
requirements for that species.
Correct by 12/22/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.137 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live animals. 
In October of 2023, the facility transported an approximately 6 week old mountain lion cross-country in a vehicle, the 
animal was outside of a primary enclosure for portions of the trip. In video documentation, facility staff can be seen 
holding the animal in their laps and placing the animal on the floor of the moving vehicle with no other form of restraint or 
control. Although, the animal was noted to be in good condition, healthy, and receiving proper care during inspection, 
transporting animals without the use of a primary enclosure puts them at risk of injury in the event of an accident. When in 
transit, it is necessary to ensure regulated animals are housed in enclosures meeting transportation regulatory 
requirements for that species. 
Correct by 12/22/23 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Geoffrey Olsen, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
